snippet: Representative Tom Petri may have violated House rules by intervening on behalf of a Pentagon contractor in which he owned stock, the office said.
abstract: Office of Congressional Ethics concludes that Rep Tom Petri, Republican from Wisconsin, may have violated House conflict of interest rules when he repeatedly intervened on behalf of a Defense Department contractor in which he owned more than $250,000 in stock.
lead_paragraph: Representative Tom Petri may have violated House rules by intervening on behalf of a Pentagon contractor in which he owned stock, the office said.

headline.main: Ethics Office Urges Inquiry of Petri, Wisconsin Republican
headline.print_headline: Ethics Inquiry Urged for Wisconsin Congressman
